examples: He gave me an emphatic no when I asked him out.

definitions.definition: Belonging to a set of English tense forms comprising the auxiliary verb do + an infinitive without to .
Belonging to a series of obstruent consonants in several Afro-Asiatic languages that are distinguished by a guttural (co-)articulation .

subdefinitions.definition: pharyngealized consonants in Arabic , Hebrew , other Northwest Semitic languages, and Berber languages
ejective consonants in Ge'ez , Amharic , other Ethiopic Semitic languages, Chadic and Cushitic languages

definitions.definition: Referring to the above consonants as well as /ħ/ and /ʕ/ (these being seen as emphatic equivalents of /h/ and /ʔ/ ).
definitions.label_groups: phonology , archaic except in layman’s use

secondary_definitions: ( grammar ) Belonging to a set of English tense forms comprising the auxiliary verb do + an infinitive without to .
( phonology ) Belonging to a series of obstruent consonants in several Afro-Asiatic languages that are distinguished by a guttural (co-)articulation .
( phonology , archaic except in layman’s use ) Referring to the above consonants as well as /ħ/ and /ʕ/ (these being seen as emphatic equivalents of /h/ and /ʔ/ ).
